title: Local AI Model Stolen
description: Your proprietary Edge AI model was extracted from the device firmware via a glitching attack. It's now trending on the Public Model Hub.

choices.text: Move critical logic to Cloud (Protect IPR)

title: Pre-Order Hype Check
description: The marketing team wants to launch a Crowdfunding Campaign. 'Just promise them the moon, we'll figure out the physics later.'

choices.text: Promise what we can actually build

title: Global Silicon Famine
description: Your MCU distributor just ghosted you. The lead time is now 96 weeks. A broker overseas says they have 'compatible' stock.

title: Flash Memory Shortage
description: Supply chain crisis! The automotive-grade flash chips are backordered for 52 weeks.

choices.text: Use Generic Consumer Flash from Overseas Vendors

title: Bit Rot Detected
description: Users are reporting their devices are forgetting their WiFi passwords. Your flash vendor says it's a 'known characteristic'.

choices.text: It's a feature, not a bug

title: Surprise GDPR Audit
description: The EU Commission wants to know where you store the user's voice logs. They mention SOMETHING about 'Article 25 - Data Protection by Design'.

title: ZombieNet 2.0 Infection
description: Your devices are being used to DDoS a cat food website in Estonia. The botnet operators send a thank you note.

title: AI Pivot
description: The CEO saw a GenAI demo. Implement 'Chat with your Juicer' feature by next week.

choices.text: Write a regex script and call it AI

title: Fake AI Exposed
description: A researcher decompiled your app and found your 'AI' is just 500 if-statements. The internet is laughing at you.

title: CRA Compliance Letter
description: The EU has sent your company a 'friendly reminder' about the upcoming Cyber Resilience Act deadline. Your SBOM is... non-existent.

choices.text: Brexit means Brexit, right? Oh wait...

title: CRA Enforcement Action
description: December 2027. The CRA is now fully enforced. EU customs has seized your latest shipment. Your CE mark is 'under review'.

title: UK PSTI Violation
description: UK Trading Standards contacts you. Apparently 'admin/admin' is not an acceptable default password. Who knew?

title: Ransomware Attack
description: Your cloud backend has been encrypted. The hackers want 50 Crypto. Your backup strategy was 'we'll figure it out later'.

choices.text: Pay the ransom (this is illegal in some jurisdictions)

title: Debug Port Exposed
description: Security researchers found your JTAG port is active in production. Your firmware is now on GitHub.

choices.text: Rush new production with fuses blown

title: Main Chip End-of-Life
description: Your SoC vendor announces they're discontinuing your chip. You have 18 months to find an alternative.

title: OTA Update Disaster
description: Your latest firmware update has bricked 15% of deployed devices. Social media is not happy.

title: Cloud Vendor Lock-in
description: The Cloud Provider announces 300% price increase for IoT Service. Your entire fleet uses their proprietary protocol.

title: Cyber Insurance Denied
description: Your cyber insurance claim is denied. 'Insufficient security controls' they say. Something about SBOM and penetration testing.

choices.text: Accept the loss and move on

title: Smart Cage Hack
description: Hackers accessed the unencrypted MQTT relay. The hamster is now participating in a DDoS attack (and is very warm).

title: DRM Server Outage
description: Your authentication server is down. 50,000 customers cannot use the product they 'bought'.

choices.text: Push update to disable DRM checks (Free fix!)
Provision emergency capacity & fix auth service

title: EU Battery Regulation
description: New EU Battery Regulation requires a 'Digital Battery Passport'. Your battery management system logs... nothing.

title: EU AI Act Audit
description: Your 'AI-powered' feature triggers EU AI Act scrutiny. They want to see your risk management system and model cards.

title: Gray Market Clone
description: A perfect clone of your product appears on a major marketplace at 1/3 the price. It even has your firmware, bugs included.

title: Nation-State Interest
description: Threat intelligence suggests a nation-state APT is targeting your device category. Your security posture is... optimistic.

title: E-Waste Disposal Crisis
description: Old devices are appearing in landfills with PII still accessible. The EU ESPR wants to 'discuss secure disposal procedures'.

title: Zombie Device Class Action
description: A class action lawsuit alleges your unpatchable devices from 2019 are being used to attack hospitals.

title: Surprise FDA Inspection
description: Inspectors have arrived. They want to see the Clinical Evaluation Report (CER) for your latest firmware patch.

title: Mega-Influencer Takedown
description: TechRoast (15M subs) just dropped a video: 'The Snuggle-Bot is SPYING on you'. It has 2M views in an hour.

title: Harvest Now, Decrypt Later
description: Intelligence agencies are recording your encrypted traffic. Your ECC-256 keys will be crackable by quantum computers in ~8 years. Your device lasts 10.

title: Cheap Bluetooth Replay
description: A Tech Vlogger opened your lock with a $5 Microcontroller. It's a simple replay attack. 'Bank Grade Security' is now a meme.

choices.text: Software fix: Rolling codes via App

title: The Parking Lot USB
description: An operator plugged a USB drive labeled 'Salary Bonuses 2026' into the airgapped control console.

title: Prohibited AI Practice
description: Marketing pushed an OTA update enabling 'Emotion Recognition' to optimize ads. Legal warns this violates EU AI Act Article 5 (Prohibited Practices).

choices.text: Claim it's for 'User Safety' (Fight the regulators)

title: GPAI Transparency Audit
description: Regulators demand 'Article 53' transparency docs for your GenAI chatbot. Since you wrappered a black-box API, you have zero documentation.

choices.text: Hire top-tier law firm to delay

title: Algorithmic Bias Scandal
description: Users discovered your smart camera auto-tags minorities as 'Suspicious'. Social Media is melting down. Data governance was nonexistent.

title: CRA: Zero-Day Discovery
description: A researcher found a root shell. Under the EU Cyber Resilience Act, you MUST provide an early warning to ENISA within 24 hours and a full notification within 72 hours.

title: GPSR: Choking Hazard
description: A toddler swallowed the volume knob. The General Product Safety Regulation demands an immediate recall unless you can prove it's an isolated incident.

title: Privacy: The 'Listening' Bear
description: Your AI bear was recording children's secrets and training the model. Huge GDPR-K and COPPA violations.

title: Root Certificate Expired
description: It's the Y2K of IoT! Your root CA certificate just expired. 10,000 devices are now bricks because they can't handshake with your server.

title: Cloud Bill Shock
description: An intern left debug logging enabled on the entire fleet. Your cloud storage bill is $100,000 this month.

choices.text: Pay it and fix the config

title: SBOM Vulnerability Found
description: Security researchers found a critical RCE in 'left-pad-iot', a library you use everywhere. It allows unauthenticated root access.

choices.text: Deny involvement ('We don't use that version')

title: CCPA Data Request Flood
description: California users have discovered the 'Delete My Data' button. Your inbox has 2,000 requests and a 45-day compliance deadline.

title: CISA Known Exploited Vulnerability
description: CISA just added your firmware vulnerability to the KEV catalog. Federal customers are contractually required to drop you in 14 days.

title: Data Broker Leak
description: Your 'anonymized' telemetry data was re-identified by researchers. Turns out device UUID + ZIP code = person. Class action lawyers are circling.

title: EU Right to Repair Directive
description: The EU Right to Repair directive now applies to your category. You must publish schematics and provide spare parts for 7 years.

title: Trade Tariff Shock
description: New 25% tariffs on electronics from your primary manufacturing hub. Your BOM cost just spiked. Shareholders want answers.

title: Rare Earth Minerals Shortage
description: Geopolitical tensions have restricted rare earth exports. Your motor supplier just paused production indefinitely.

choices.text: Emergency stockpile (if you can find any)

title: Security Researcher Kudos
description: A famous security researcher tweets: 'I just audited [YOUR DEVICE] and... it's actually secure? What timeline is this?' You're going viral for good reasons.

title: Revenue Collapse
description: Being banned from key markets has finally hit the bottom line. Quarterly revenue is down 40% and cash flow is critical.

title: Shareholder Revolt
description: Investors are furious about the margin compression. They demand immediate cost-cutting or a leadership change.

title: Supply Chain Resilience
description: A competitor just went bankrupt due to the shortage, but your stockpile kept you shipping. The market rewards your foresight.

title: Class Action Settlement
description: The lawsuits have piled up. Your legal team advises settling before discovery reveals the embarrassing Team Chat messages.

title: Regulatory Fine
description: Regulators have lost patience with your minimal compliance efforts. A significant fine has been levied.

choices.text: Pay fine and commit to compliance

title: Legacy Code Crash
description: That 'temp fix' from last year just caused a cascading failure in the core loop. Devices are rebooting every 5 minutes.

title: EU Green Deal Grant
description: Your commitment to sustainability qualifies you for an EU innovation grant.

title: FinTech Partnership
description: Bank partners trust your hardware security module for their new app.

title: Clinical Validation Opportunity
description: A university hospital offers to run a clinical study on your device's data accuracy. It's expensive but validates your tech.

choices.text: We don't need 'science', we have marketing

title: EU Compliance Certification
description: The legal team suggests proactive certification for the EU market before the regulators come knocking.

title: Whistleblower Leak
description: A former engineer has leaked your falsified battery compliance data to The Tech Crunch. The report is damning.

title: Logic Bomb Detonation
description: The nation-state actors that infiltrated your network months ago have triggered a kill-switch. Your fleet is turning into bricks.

choices.text: This is beyond us... call the NSA

title: Landfill Investigation
description: Investigative journalists found your devices in a Ghanaian landfill. They were supposed to be recycled, but they are just leaking lithium.

title: Silent Fleet Failure
description: Customers are screaming on Social Media, but your dashboards show all green. You flew blind and hit a mountain.

title: Harvest Now, Decrypt Later
description: It's 2030. Quantum computers just broke RSA-2048. All that data you collected 5 years ago is now public.

title: Catastrophic Component Failure
description: The cheap capacitors you used to save $0.02 are popping after 18 months. It's not a bug, it's chemistry.

title: Regulator Shut Down
description: You've been on probation for a year. You missed the deadline. The FDA/FCC/CE has revoked your license to sell.

title: Privacy Certification Award
description: An independent privacy certification body has completed their audit of your data handling practices. They want to endorse your product as 'Privacy Certified'.

title: Secure Boot Vindication
description: Security researchers publish a detailed analysis of your secure boot implementation. They call it 'exemplary' and submit it as a case study.

title: EU AI Act Safe Harbor
description: EU AI Act enforcement begins. Your compliance documentation is thorough. Regulators let you operate while competitors face fines.

title: Cloud Vendor Lock-in Victory
description: Your multi-cloud strategy pays off. Major competitor's sole provider gets hit by massive outage. You're the only vendor still online.

title: SBOM Advantage
description: Critical zero-day discovered in a widely-used library. You patch in 48 hours. Competitors struggle because they don't know their dependencies.

title: Ransomware Industry Sweep
description: Ransomware sweeps the industry. Your backup strategy lets you restore in hours. Competitors pay millions in ransom.

title: Energy Crisis Opportunity
description: European energy crisis drives demand for ultra-efficient IoT. Your low-power design is suddenly very attractive.

title: Post-Quantum Cryptography Win
description: First practical quantum computer breaks RSA-2048. Industry panics. Your post-quantum implementation is unaffected.

title: Supplier Exclusivity Deal
description: Your largest component supplier offers a 3-year exclusive partnership. Preferential pricing in exchange for guaranteed volume.

title: Contract Manufacturer Partnership
description: Your contract manufacturer offers strategic equity partnership. 15% stake in exchange for priority capacity and operational excellence.

title: Container Ship Crisis
description: Shipping container crisis. 40% of containers are backlisted. Your Q2 production run is stuck at sea.

title: Supplier Bankruptcy
description: Your primary component supplier files for Chapter 11. You have 4 weeks of buffer stock. Your options are limited.

choices.text: Find alternate supplier at premium cost

title: Penetration Test Results
description: Third-party penetration testing reveals multiple high-severity vulnerabilities in firmware and cloud API.

title: Firmware Attestation Standard
description: Industry working group recommends cryptographic firmware verification. Competitors ignore it. You can get ahead of the curve.

title: Supply Chain Software Audit
description: Comprehensive audit of third-party libraries reveals: 3 high-severity vulns, 12 medium, 40+ low. Decision time.

choices.text: It's third-party code, not our problem

title: Red Team Exercise
description: Internal red team tests your zero-trust architecture. They breach the perimeter in 4 hours but can't lateral-move. Impressive.

title: Patent Filing Opportunity
description: Your firmware implements a novel compression algorithm not seen in the industry. Patent attorney recommends filing internationally.

title: Competitor Intelligence Risk
description: Competitor's engineer applies for job. Brings 'reference materials' on USB. Legal flags it as potential IP theft attempt.

title: Open Source Opportunity
description: Consider open-sourcing non-critical reference code. Build ecosystem goodwill and attract talented contributors.

title: Differential Privacy Proposal
description: Privacy researcher proposes differential privacy layer for telemetry. Adds noise to prevent re-identification of users.

title: Zero-Knowledge Authentication
description: Fintech partner proposes ZKP integration for passwordless authentication. Novel technology but reduces liability significantly.

title: Government Procurement Contract
description: National government agency wants 15,000 units/year for 3 years. Lucrative but requires compliance certifications you already have.

title: Series A Funding Round
description: Venture capital firm wants to invest for 18% equity. Accelerates growth but dilutes control.

title: Cyber Insurance Premium Cut
description: Your security posture audit results in 45% premium reduction on cyber liability insurance. The CFO is thrilled.

title: Tech Debt Meltdown
description: Years of 'quick fixes' cascade. Three subsystems fail simultaneously under load. The intern's hotfix from 2024 is the root cause.

title: Silent Outage Discovery
description: 6-hour fleet outage goes undetected by your dashboards. Customers flood social media while you're blissfully unaware.

title: Viral Demand Spike
description: Your product goes viral on TikTok. Demand exceeds supply by 10x. You have 2 weeks to decide: scale or miss the window.

title: Recall Redemption
description: Your recall completed. Offer lifetime warranty and extended support as goodwill to rebuild customer trust.
